data.title: Charles Dickens' Birthplace Museum
data.text:
The Charles Dickens Birthplace Museum is the perfect place to start exploring and experiencing the work of one of England’s most famous and best-loved writers.

Walk around the first home of Charles Dickens, which contains some of his prized personal possessions and has been fantastically decorated in the Regency style. Put yourself in the place where literary history was made.

Opening times

The museum is open 10am – 4.30pm (last admission 4pm) on selected days throughout the year. See the visit page for the full list. Please note additional opening days may be added so we recommend checking the visit page ahead of your visit.
